snippet: The denial was China’s first substantial response to the claim that it had aimed radar capable of aiding weapon strikes at a Japanese naval vessel and helicopter near disputed islands.
abstract: China denies Japanese accusations that its ships directed radar capable of aiding weapon strikes at Japanese naval vessel and helicopter near disputed islands in East China Sea.

byline.contributor: Bree Feng and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The denial was China’s first substantial response to the claim that it had aimed radar capable of aiding weapon strikes at a Japanese naval vessel and helicopter near disputed islands.

headline.seo: China Denies Directing Radar at Japanese Military
headline.main: China Denies Directing Radar at Japanese Naval Vessel and Copter
headline.print_headline: China Denies Directing Radar at Japanese Naval Vessel and Copter
